cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 490 miles SE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Henri is expected to curve northwest on Friday, then accelerate north-northeast this weekend, tracking toward southern New England while remaining east of the Mid-Atlantic coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England coast (Long Island/RI vicinity)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic and New England coastline from the Outer Banks of North Carolina to Maine
weather_observation.wind: Gusts up to tropical-storm force (around 40 mph) possible Sunday as Henri passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (around 1–2 ft) possible in the Delaware Bay and tidal Delaware River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Brief periods of heavy rain are possible, with totals generally 1–3 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents may disrupt vessel movements and pilotage operations.
